alert.note: Alert for Hardin (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 3:41PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL HARDIN COUNTY THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 341 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Kenton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, half inch hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Kenton, Forest, Dunkirk, Blanchard, Patterson, Grant, Mentzer and Pfeiffer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
